STRATEGY.objection_type: VEHICLE - Why the OLD products/methods failed her
STRATEGY.contrast: Micro Features handle this LOGISTICALLY in the Grid

the_secret.meaning: Why other pieces disappointed her - it's not her fault, it's THEIRS
the_secret.philosophical_angle: The industry sold her inferior products and blamed HER body

E_cognitive_disruption.what: Open with belief-breaking statement about the old vehicle/method
E_cognitive_disruption.example: That 'premium' jacket you bought last season? It was designed to fail.

N_unfinished_story.what: Begin a story about discovering WHY old methods fail
N_unfinished_story.example: I spent 3 years in fashion manufacturing. What I saw would make you never buy fast fashion again...

G_controversial_truth.what: Reveal the insider secret about the old vehicle
G_controversial_truth.example: Here's what they don't tell you: Most 'luxury' brands use the same suppliers as H&M. The only difference is the label sewn inside.

A_personal_stakes.what: Make it emotional - the cost of using the wrong vehicle
A_personal_stakes.example: I wasted hundreds on pieces that pilled, faded, and fell apart. Each one felt like a personal failure.

G_unconventional_payoff.what: Promise what THIS vehicle delivers differently
G_unconventional_payoff.example: This fabrication doesn't just look better - it's engineered to get softer with every wash while holding its shape for years.

E_time_locked_curiosity.what: Create urgency around the new vehicle/method
E_time_locked_curiosity.example: Most brands won't use this fabric because it costs 4x more. We do because we refuse to sell you something that'll disappoint you.

images.NOT: testimonial images (those are for Micro Features)

vehicle_angles_for_fashion: Fabrication - Why cheap fabric fails (pilling, stretching, fading)
Construction - Why cheap stitching fails (seams, hems, structure)
Design - Why trend-chasing fails (unflattering cuts, poor fit)
Manufacturing - Why fast fashion fails (quality control, materials)

tone_guidance.write_like: An industry insider exposing why the old way never worked
tone_guidance.voice: Authoritative, slightly indignant on her behalf, revealing
tone_guidance.MUST_USE: Exact language patterns from research-summary.md Voice & Tone
use: here's what they don't tell you

anti_laziness_check: Does this PHILOSOPHICALLY explain why old products failed?
Did I shift blame FROM her TO the products?
Did I use all 6 ENGAGE elements?
Am I using PRODUCT/LIFESTYLE images (not testimonials)?
Would she feel VINDICATED reading this?
Did I use language from the research Voice & Tone section?
